H0.text: Gas is the amount that the pressure inside a container depends on.

H1.text: Air is the amount that the pressure inside a container depends on.

H2.text: Emissions is the amount inside a container that the pressure inside depends on.

H3.text: Liquids are the amount inside a container that the pressure depends on.

A4.text: The ideal gas law (PV = NkBT) indicates that pressure depends on the number of particles (N), which corresponds to the amount of gas.

A5.text: The amount of substance of gas (number of moles) is a key factor in the ideal gas law (PV = nRT), indicating that pressure depends on the quantity of gas present.
